Allright! I'm all settled in at college here at RPI, across the US from
where I'm used to coding, and I think I can finally resume work on
Openglad. I've been busy for the past month settling in and stuff so I
havn't coded a single (useful) line. Homework permitting, I'll be coding
a lot more now.

Starting yesterday, its Sean's turn to get settled into college, so
development will still probably still be really slow until he's all set.
For now I'm planning on putting in scripting (and reworking charfiles)
in Lua, maybe to the point where people can completely script character
classes, specials and all. The possibility is definitely there. If
anyone has any good ideas, email me and let me know.

Also, if there's a Windows SDL guru listening, help me with fullscreen
in windows!

-- 
Zardus <Zardus@...>
